0.subject_description: HPE ProLiant DL380 Gen10 Server - SCM_HW:ILO not working on server vabedr10 : E-IM031905350
0.description_description:
Problem Description:  ILO not working on Vaillant vabedr10 / HWC needed  HWC to HPE needs to be open regarding not working iLO on server vabedr10.  When we start “ HP Lights-Out Configuration Utility”  We cannot reach ILO console from server itselt or from hop server. Currently ILO is not working at all.  error: Error fetching ILO security state.  Serial number:  Preferred contact method: Email Contact hours/time zone: (GMT+01:00) Amsterdam, Berlin, Bern, Rome, Stockholm, Vienna Preferred service method: HPE Support Engineer Site access details:    Equipment Address: Steve van Nieuwenhoven,,steve.van.nieuwenhoven@vaillant-group.com,Vaillant,Vaillant Belgium Golden Hopestraat 15 1620 Drogenbos,,MS: ,,Drogenbos,Drogenbos,1620,BELGIUM Product Number: 868703-B21, Serial Number: CZ2846028W Trouble Shooting: We cannot reach ILO console from server itselt or from hop server. Currently ILO is not working at all. OS Revision:  Product Version:  SAR: 840742120

Please find below the steps:  NVRAM Clear:  This How-to describes, how to clear the CMOS and NVRAM using the System Maintenance Switch on the system board:  power down the server disconnect the power plugs open the server Now you have to identify the system maintenance switch:  At the server cover you can find a plan to locate the switch:  Now change position 6 of the system maintenance switch from the default position “off” to “on”:  Connect the power plugs and power up the server The following message will be displayed:  Maintenance switch detected in the ON position. The system is being default configured. This may take a few minutes… Power off the server and toggle the maintenance switch to the OFF position.  shut down the server and disconnect the power plugs change position 6 back to “off” Connect the power plugs and power up the server  Please use “Reply to All” while replying to this e-mail for continued support.  Feel free to revert back to this mail for any queries  Regards, Biju Sen Technical Solutions Consultant Hewlett Packard Enterprise Working Days: Mon-Fri 08:00-17:00 CET (Business Hours) Team PDL – Business house cscbglner_compute@hpe.com Out of Business Hours: ner_ooh_sofia@hpe.com Escalations 24x7 response - cers@hpe.com Feedback to my manager – Sathya Ambati Narayanan – sathya-ambati.narayanan@hpe.com” If you need urgent support over the phone please find the support options for your country on the CONTACT HPE WORLDWIDE home page: HPE Worldwide Contact You can also log a new case, check the status/update details or raise a call back request on an existing case using the link provided: HPE Support Case Manager   --------------- Original Message --------------- From: Masalski, Nikolay Krasimirov [nikolay-krasimirov.masalski@dxc.com] Sent: 14/4/2021 5:13 pm To: gsd_csc_case_mngmt@hpe.com Cc: cscbglner_compute@hpe.com; gsd_csc_case_mngmt@hpe.com Cc: cscbglner_compute@hpe.com; rdc-bg-nce1-sms-win-iaction1@dxc.com; pdl-vaillant-gcb-win@dxc.com Subject: RE: HPE Support Case 5354805609 [ ref:_00Dd0bUlK._5001V18zjQP:ref ]   Hello Andrew,  Can you please check in your contract if such engineer visit is not possible? Also when we try to use HP Lights-out Online configuration utility the message below appears:  [cid:image003.jpg@01D73D0F.CC3C8100]    Nikolay Masalski Windows Delivery Lead, GIDC Eastern Europe  nikolay-krasimirov.masalski@dxc.com  DXC Technology Business Park Sofia 1766 Sofia, Bulgaria  dxc.technology  Learn more about our center: GIDC Eastern Europe    From: HPE Case Management System > Sent: Thursday, April 8, 2021 3:13 PM To: Masalski, Nikolay Krasimirov (WIN DL) > Cc: PDL-VAILLANT-GCB-WIN >; cscbglner_compute@hpe.com; RDC-BG-NCE1-SMS-WIN-iAction1 > Subject: RE: HPE Support Case 5354805609 [ ref:_00Dd0bUlK._5001V18zjQP:ref ]  Hi Nikolay ,  Greetings from HPE.  This is regarding case :5354805609  Onsite engineer can only be scheduled for part replacement. Please check the below link and go through document.  https://clicktime.symantec.com/3H1h9ZSRgSGCV2ZcCSYZ6Q17Vc?u=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.hpe.com%2Fhpesc%2Fpublic%2FdocDisplay%3FdocId%3Da00076248en_us%26docLocale%3Den_US%23%3A~%3Atext%3DiLO%2520is%2520inaccessible%2520after%2520an%2520update%2520to%2520the%2520network%2520settings.%26text%3DThe%2520NIC%2520and%2520the%2520switch%2520settings%2520are%2520not%2520the%2520same.%26text%3DVerify%2520that%2520both%2520sides%2520of%2Cautoselect%252C%2520speed%252C%2520and%2520duplex.  Regards, Arun Anto Technical Solutions Consultant Hewlett Packard Enterprise Working Days: Mon-Fri 08:00-17:00 CET (Business Hours) Team PDL – Business house cscbglner_compute@hpe.com Out of Business Hours: ner_ooh_sofia@hpe.com Escalations 24x7 response - cers@hpe.com Feedback to my manager – Narayanan, Sathya Ambati -- sathya-ambati.narayanan@hpe.com” If you need urgent support over the phone please find the support options for your country on the CONTACT HPE WORLDWIDE home page: HPE Worldwide Contact You can also log a new case, check the status / update details or raise a call back request on an existing case using the link provided :HPE Support Case Manager   --------------- Original Message --------------- From: Masalski, Nikolay Krasimirov [nikolay-krasimirov.masalski@dxc.com] Sent: 08/04/2021 12:21 To: gsd_csc_case_mngmt@hpe.com Cc: cscbglner_compute@hpe.com; rdc-bg-nce1-sms-win-iaction1@dxc.com; pdl-vaillant-gcb-win@dxc.com Subject: RE: HPE Support Case 5354805609 [ ref:_00Dd0bUlK._5001V18zjQP:ref ]   Hello,  In case this is the only possible option I am afraid that you need to send engineer to perform the activity.   Nikolay Masalski Windows Delivery Lead, GIDC Eastern Europe  nikolay-krasimirov.masalski@dxc.com  DXC Technology Business Park Sofia 1766 Sofia, Bulgaria  dxc.technology  Learn more about our center: GIDC Eastern Europe    From: HPE Case Management System > Sent: Thursday, April 8, 2021 9:52 AM To: RDC-BG-NCE1-SMS-WIN-iAction1 > Cc: PDL-VAILLANT-GCB-WIN >; cscbglner_compute@hpe.com; RDC-BG-NCE1-SMS-WIN-iAction1 > Subject: RE: HPE Support Case 5354805609 [ ref:_00Dd0bUlK._5001V18zjQP:ref ]  Hi ,  Greetings from HPE.  This is regarding case :5354805609  Steps to clear NVRAM and please find the steps below:  1.    Turn off the server. Unplug all the cables. 2.    Open the server, remove the access panel. 3.    On the Panel, we have a sticker which show us the layout of the motherboard. 4.    Locate the System Maintenance Switch, it is like a copper plate with 8 DIP switches. 5.    Now, once we locate the switch, then we have to move the 6th switch to ON state. 6.    Then put cable back and then turn on the server. 7.    Once we turn on the server, then we will get the message that System Maintenance switch is on and we need to turn it off. 8.    Then again turn off the server, unplug the cables and then put the 6th DIP switch back to OFF. 9.    Then connect all the cables back and turn on the server.  Regards, Arun Anto Technical Solutions Consultant Hewlett Packard Enterprise Working Days: Mon-Fri 08:00-17:00 CET (Business Hours) Team PDL – Business house cscbglner_compute@hpe.com Out of Business Hours: ner_ooh_sofia@hpe.com Escalations 24x7 response - cers@hpe.com Feedback to my manager – Narayanan, Sathya Ambati -- sathya-ambati.narayanan@hpe.com” If you need urgent support over the phone please find the support options for your country on the CONTACT HPE WORLDWIDE home page: HPE Worldwide Contact You can also log a new case, check the status / update details or raise a call back request on an existing case using the link provided :HPE Support Case Manager   --------------- Original Message --------------- From: RDC-BG-NCE1-SMS-WIN-iAction1 [rdc-bg-nce1-sms-win-iaction1@dxc.com] Sent: 07/04/2021 16:16 To: gsd_csc_case_mngmt@hpe.com Cc: cscbglner_compute@hpe.com; Please find below the steps:  NVRAM Clear:  This How-to describes, how to clear the CMOS and NVRAM using the System Maintenance Switch on the system board:  power down the server disconnect the power plugs open the server Now you have to identify the system maintenance switch:  At the server cover you can find a plan to locate the switch:  Now change position 6 of the system maintenance switch from the default position “off” to “on”:  Connect the power plugs and power up the server The following message will be displayed:  Maintenance switch detected in the ON position. The system is being default configured. This may take a few minutes… Power off the server and toggle the maintenance switch to the OFF position.  shut down the server and disconnect the power plugs change position 6 back to “off” Connect the power plugs and power up the server  Please use “Reply to All” while replying to this e-mail for continued support.  Feel free to revert back to this mail for any queries  Regards, Biju Sen Technical Solutions Consultant Hewlett Packard Enterprise Working Days: Mon-Fri 08:00-17:00 CET (Business Hours) Team PDL – Business house cscbglner_compute@hpe.com Out of Business Hours: ner_ooh_sofia@hpe.com Escalations 24x7 response - cers@hpe.com Feedback to my manager – Sathya Ambati Narayanan – sathya-ambati.narayanan@hpe.com” If you need urgent support over the phone please find the support options for your country on the CONTACT HPE WORLDWIDE home page: HPE Worldwide Contact You can also log a new case, check the status/update details or raise a call back request on an existing case using the link provided: HPE Support Case Manager   --------------- Original Message --------------- From: Masalski, Nikolay Krasimirov [nikolay-krasimirov.masalski@dxc.com] Sent: 14/4/2021 5:13 pm To: gsd_csc_case_mngmt@hpe.com Cc: cscbglner_compute@hpe.com; rdc-bg-nce1-sms-win-iaction1@dxc.com; pdl-vaillant-gcb-win@dxc.com Subject: RE: HPE Support Case 5354805609 [ ref:_00Dd0bUlK._5001V18zjQP:ref ]   Hello,  In case this is the only possible option I am afraid that you need to send engineer to perform the activity.   Nikolay Masalski Windows Delivery Lead, GIDC Eastern Europe  nikolay-krasimirov.masalski@dxc.com  DXC Technology Business Park Sofia 1766 Sofia, Bulgaria  dxc.technology  Learn more about our center: GIDC Eastern Europe    From: HPE Case Management System > Sent: Thursday, April 8, 2021 9:52 AM To: RDC-BG-NCE1-SMS-WIN-iAction1 > Cc: PDL-VAILLANT-GCB-WIN >; cscbglner_compute@hpe.com; RDC-BG-NCE1-SMS-WIN-iAction1 > Subject: RE: HPE Support Case 5354805609 [ ref:_00Dd0bUlK._5001V18zjQP:ref ]  Hi ,  Greetings from HPE.  This is regarding case :5354805609  Steps to clear NVRAM and please find the steps below:  1.    Turn off the server. Unplug all the cables. 2.    Open the server, remove the access panel. 3.    On the Panel, we have a sticker which show us the layout of the motherboard. 4.    Locate the System Maintenance Switch, it is like a copper plate with 8 DIP switches. 5.    Now, once we locate the switch, then we have to move the 6th switch to ON state. 6.    Then put cable back and then turn on the server. 7.    Once we turn on the server, then we will get the message that System Maintenance switch is on and we need to turn it off. 8.    Then again turn off the server, unplug the cables and then put the 6th DIP switch back to OFF. 9.    Then connect all the cables back and turn on the server.  Regards, Arun Anto Technical Solutions Consultant Hewlett Packard Enterprise Working Days: Mon-Fri 08:00-17:00 CET (Business Hours) Team PDL – Business house cscbglner_compute@hpe.com Out of Business Hours: ner_ooh_sofia@hpe.com Escalations 24x7 response - cers@hpe.com Feedback to my manager – Narayanan, Sathya Ambati -- sathya-ambati.narayanan@hpe.com” If you need urgent support over the phone please find the support options for your country on the CONTACT HPE WORLDWIDE home page: HPE Worldwide Contact You can also log a new case, check the status / update details or raise a call back request on an existing case using the link provided :HPE Support Case Manager   --------------- Original Message --------------- From: RDC-BG-NCE1-SMS-WIN-iAction1 [rdc-bg-nce1-sms-win-iaction1@dxc.com] Sent: 07/04/2021 16:16 To: gsd_csc_case_mngmt@hpe.com Cc: cscbglner_compute@hpe.com; At Algoleap, Product engineering is a comprehensive
discipline that tackles a product’s journey from
conception to user adoption. It begins with design
thinking, a human-centered approach to understand user
needs and craft solutions that effectively address them.
Then, agile iterations come into play. Products are
developed and refined through short, iterative cycles
allowing for continuous feedback and improvement via a
LEAN MVP approach. Finally, digital adoption ensures
users can successfully integrate the product into their
workflows, fostering long-term success. Capabilities are
manifold including custom applications, mobile
capabilities, data amongst others.

Please find below the steps:  NVRAM Clear:  This How-to describes, how to clear the CMOS and NVRAM using the System Maintenance Switch on the system board:  power down the server disconnect the power plugs open the server Now you have to identify the system maintenance switch:  At the server cover you can find a plan to locate the switch:  Now change position 6 of the system maintenance switch from the default position “off” to “on”:  Connect the power plugs and power up the server The following message will be displayed:  Maintenance switch detected in the ON position. The system is being default configured. Unplug all the cables. 2.    Open the server, remove the access panel. 3.    On the Panel, we have a sticker which show us the layout of the motherboard. 4.    Locate the System Maintenance Switch, it is like a copper plate with 8 DIP switches. 5.    Now, once we locate the switch, then we have to move the 6th switch to ON state. 6.    Then put cable back and then turn on the server. 7.    Once we turn on the server, then we will get the message that System Maintenance switch is on and we need to turn it off. 8.    Then again turn off the server, unplug the cables and then put the 6th DIP switch back to OFF. 9.    Then connect all the cables back and turn on the server.  Regards, Arun Anto Technical Solutions Consultant Hewlett Packard Enterprise Working Days: Mon-Fri 08:00-17:00 CET (Business Hours) Team PDL – Business house cscbglner_compute@hpe.com Out of Business Hours: ner_ooh_sofia@hpe.com Escalations 24x7 response - cers@hpe.com Feedback to my manager – Narayanan, Sathya Ambati -- sathya-ambati.narayanan@hpe.com” If you need urgent support over the phone please find the support options for your country on the CONTACT HPE WORLDWIDE home page: HPE Worldwide Contact You can also log a new case, check the status / update details or raise a call back request on an existing case using the link provided :HPE Support Case Manager   --------------- Original Message --------------- From: RDC-BG-NCE1-SMS-WIN-iAction1 [rdc-bg-nce1-sms-win-iaction1@dxc.com] Sent: 07/04/2021 16:16 To: gsd_csc_case_mngmt@hpe.com Cc: cscbglner_compute@hpe.com; Please find below the steps:  NVRAM Clear:  This How-to describes, how to clear the CMOS and NVRAM using the System Maintenance Switch on the system board:  power down the server disconnect the power plugs open the server Now you have to identify the system maintenance switch:  At the server cover you can find a plan to locate the switch:  Now change position 6 of the system maintenance switch from the default position “off” to “on”:  Connect the power plugs and power up the server The following message will be displayed:  Maintenance switch detected in the ON position. The system is being default configured. Unplug all the cables. 2.    Open the server, remove the access panel. 3.    On the Panel, we have a sticker which show us the layout of the motherboard. 4.    Locate the System Maintenance Switch, it is like a copper plate with 8 DIP switches. 5.    Now, once we locate the switch, then we have to move the 6th switch to ON state. 6.    Then put cable back and then turn on the server. 7.    Once we turn on the server, then we will get the message that System Maintenance switch is on and we need to turn it off. 8.    Then again turn off the server, unplug the cables and then put the 6th DIP switch back to OFF. 9.    Then connect all the cables back and turn on the server.  Regards, Arun Anto Technical Solutions Consultant Hewlett Packard Enterprise Working Days: Mon-Fri 08:00-17:00 CET (Business Hours) Team PDL – Business house cscbglner_compute@hpe.com Out of Business Hours: ner_ooh_sofia@hpe.com Escalations 24x7 response - cers@hpe.com Feedback to my manager – Narayanan, Sathya Ambati -- sathya-ambati.narayanan@hpe.com” If you need urgent support over the phone please find the support options for your country on the CONTACT HPE WORLDWIDE home page: HPE Worldwide Contact You can also log a new case, check the status / update details or raise a call back request on an existing case using the link provided :HPE Support Case Manager   --------------- Original Message --------------- From: RDC-BG-NCE1-SMS-WIN-iAction1 [rdc-bg-nce1-sms-win-iaction1@dxc.com] Sent: 07/04/2021 16:16 To: gsd_csc_case_mngmt@hpe.com Cc: cscbglner_compute@hpe.com; Please find below the steps:  NVRAM Clear:  This How-to describes, how to clear the CMOS and NVRAM using the System Maintenance Switch on the system board:  power down the server disconnect the power plugs open the server Now you have to identify the system maintenance switch:  At the server cover you can find a plan to locate the switch:  Now change position 6 of the system maintenance switch from the default position “off” to “on”:  Connect the power plugs and power up the server The following message will be displayed:  Maintenance switch detected in the ON position. The system is being default configured. This may take a few minutes… Power off the server and toggle the maintenance switch to the OFF position.  shut down the server and disconnect the power plugs change position 6 back to “off” Connect the power plugs and power up the server  Please use “Reply to All” while replying to this e-mail for continued support.  Feel free to revert back to this mail for any queries  Regards, Biju Sen Technical Solutions Consultant Hewlett Packard Enterprise Working Days: Mon-Fri 08:00-17:00 CET (Business Hours) Team PDL – Business house cscbglner_compute@hpe.com Out of Business Hours: ner_ooh_sofia@hpe.com Escalations 24x7 response - cers@hpe.com Feedback to my manager – Sathya Ambati Narayanan – sathya-ambati.narayanan@hpe.com” If you need urgent support over the phone please find the support options for your country on the CONTACT HPE WORLDWIDE home page: HPE Worldwide Contact You can also log a new case, check the status/update details or raise a call back request on an existing case using the link provided: HPE Support Case Manager   --------------- Original Message --------------- From: Masalski, Nikolay Krasimirov [nikolay-krasimirov.masalski@dxc.com] Sent: 14/4/2021 5:13 pm To: gsd_csc_case_mngmt@hpe.com Cc: cscbglner_compute@hpe.com; rdc-bg-nce1-sms-win-iaction1@dxc.com; pdl-vaillant-gcb-win@dxc.com; andrew.redfern@dxc.com Subject: RE: HPE Support Case 5354805609 [ ref:_00Dd0bUlK._5001V18zjQP:ref ] Hello,   Can you please advise us how to do it, as I cannot find related documentation.     Nikolay Masalski Windows Delivery Lead, GIDC Eastern Europe nikolay-krasimirov.masalski@dxc.com  DXC Technology Business Park Sofia 1766 Sofia, Bulgaria  dxc.technology

Source: Email from GRS TM Sathya.  From: Narayanan, Sathya Ambati (Service Delivery Manager, NER ISS & Storage (GRSB))   Sent: Tuesday, April 27, 2021 8:43 AM To: HPE Customer Relations  Cc: CSCBNER_Compute  Subject: FW: HPE Support Case 5354805609 [ ref:_00Dd0bUlK._5001V18zjQP:ref ]  Team,  Here the below steps to clear NVRAM is customer procedure, however he is requesting for HPE CE, Please assist in setting customer expectation.   Sathya.A Service Delivery Manager, (NER Compute & Storage) HPE Pointnext Global Remote Services (GRS) Bangalore     Technology Services  Email: sat1981@hpe.com Phone: +91 7259955535  Working hours :  Mon-Fri 13:30 – 22:30 HRS IST ( GMT+ 5:30) Scheduled Absence: NA  The contents of this message and any attachments to it are confidential and may be legally privileged. If you have received this message in error, you should delete it from your system immediately and advise the sender. To any recipient of this message within HPE, unless otherwise stated you should consider this message and attachments as "HPE CONFIDENTIAL“.   From: Masalski, Nikolay Krasimirov (WIN DL) [mailto:nikolay-krasimirov.masalski@dxc.com]  Sent: Monday, April 26, 2021 9:41 PM To: HPE Case Management System  Cc: PDL-VAILLANT-GCB-WIN ; CSCBNER_Compute ; Redfern, Andrew ; RDC-BG-NCE1-SMS-WIN-iAction1  Subject: RE: HPE Support Case 5354805609 [ ref:_00Dd0bUlK._5001V18zjQP:ref ]  Hello,  There is no update. I told you already – customer has purchased this device with warranty. How it is supposed unqualified person to open the device and manipulate it? Maybe this is against warranty policy … I don’t know….  Please add next level of support or your manager here. I want to know why there is no option to send technician to perform this activity.   Nikolay Masalski Windows Delivery Lead, GIDC Eastern Europe  nikolay-krasimirov.masalski@dxc.com  DXC Technology Business Park Sofia 1766 Sofia, Bulgaria  dxc.technology  Learn more about our center: GIDC Eastern Europe      From: HPE Case Management System   Sent: Monday, April 26, 2021 11:18 AM To: Masalski, Nikolay Krasimirov (WIN DL)  Cc: PDL-VAILLANT-GCB-WIN ; cscbglner_compute@hpe.com; Redfern, Andrew ; RDC-BG-NCE1-SMS-WIN-iAction1  Subject: RE: HPE Support Case 5354805609 [ ref:_00Dd0bUlK._5001V18zjQP:ref ]  Hi Nikolay ,  Greetings from HPE.  This is regarding case :5354805609  Please provide an update on the case.   Regards, Arun Anto Technical Solutions Consultant Hewlett Packard Enterprise Working Days: Mon-Fri 08:00-17:00 CET (Business Hours) Team PDL – Business house cscbglner_compute@hpe.com Out of Business Hours: ner_ooh_sofia@hpe.com Escalations 24x7 response - cers@hpe.com Feedback to my manager – Narayanan, Sathya Ambati -- sathya-ambati.narayanan@hpe.com” If you need urgent support over the phone please find the support options for your country on the CONTACT HPE WORLDWIDE home page: HPE Worldwide Contact You can also log a new case, check the status / update details or raise a call back request on an existing case using the link provided :HPE Support Case Manager   --------------- Original Message --------------- From: HPE Case Management System [gsd_csc_case_mngmt@hpe.com] Sent: 19/04/2021 06:53 To: nikolay-krasimirov.masalski@dxc.com Cc: pdl-vaillant-gcb-win@dxc.com; cscbglner_compute@hpe.com; rdc-bg-nce1-sms-win-iaction1@dxc.com; andrew.redfern@dxc.com Subject: RE: HPE Support Case 5354805609 [ ref:_00Dd0bUlK._5001V18zjQP:ref ]  Hi Nikolay,  Apologies for the delay in response. Please find below the steps:  NVRAM Clear:  This How-to describes, how to clear the CMOS and NVRAM using the System Maintenance Switch on the system board:  power down the server disconnect the power plugs open the server Now you have to identify the system maintenance switch:  At the server cover you can find a plan to locate the switch:  Now change position 6 of the system maintenance switch from the default position “off” to “on”:  Connect the power plugs and power up the server The following message will be displayed:  Maintenance switch detected in the ON position. The system is being default configured. This may take a few minutes… Power off the server and toggle the maintenance switch to the OFF position.  shut down the server and disconnect the power plugs change position 6 back to “off” Connect the power plugs and power up the server  Please use “Reply to All” while replying to this e-mail for continued support.  Feel free to revert back to this mail for any queries  Regards, Biju Sen Technical Solutions Consultant Hewlett Packard Enterprise Working Days: Mon-Fri 08:00-17:00 CET (Business Hours) Team PDL – Business house cscbglner_compute@hpe.com Out of Business Hours: ner_ooh_sofia@hpe.com Escalations 24x7 response - cers@hpe.com Feedback to my manager – Sathya Ambati Narayanan – sathya-ambati.narayanan@hpe.com” If you need urgent support over the phone please find the support options for your country on the CONTACT HPE WORLDWIDE home page: HPE Worldwide Contact You can also log a new case, check the status/update details or raise a call back request on an existing case using the link provided: HPE Support Case Manager   --------------- Original Message --------------- From: Masalski, Nikolay Krasimirov [nikolay-krasimirov.masalski@dxc.com] Sent: 14/4/2021 5:13 pm To: gsd_csc_case_mngmt@hpe.com Cc: cscbglner_compute@hpe.com; rdc-bg-nce1-sms-win-iaction1@dxc.com; pdl-vaillant-gcb-win@dxc.com; andrew.redfern@dxc.com Subject: RE: HPE Support Case 5354805609 [ ref:_00Dd0bUlK._5001V18zjQP:ref ] Hello,   Can you please advise us how to do it, as I cannot find related documentation.     Nikolay Masalski Windows Delivery Lead, GIDC Eastern Europe nikolay-krasimirov.masalski@dxc.com  DXC Technology Business Park Sofia 1766 Sofia, Bulgaria  dxc.technology

11.cause_plain_text: Server auto reboot and post UMCE & PCI errors in 2020  ;
11.resolution_plain_text: Mar-19: From the IML log, I found that the PCI error occurred in December 2020, and there are no new errors in 2021. Please check the server status and let me know if further support is needed. ; Mar-23: FB confirm no issue, agree close the case
11.textbody: Hello All,  Please provide the logs to check  HPE received a case about DL380 Gen9 PCI error. Please provide problem details/error messages/screenshots and collect request logs for inspection. Thanks.     1.  HP ProLiant Gen8/9/10 Servers - How to Generate Active Health System log via iLO4 GUI: a.        Logon to HP iLO 4/5 GUI (IP address at POST visible or check server iLO Default Network Settings tag for DNS name). b.       Navigation to Information > Active Health System Log . c.        Verify the date interval (default is 7 days) and make sure that all possible failures are covered within this date range as selected. d.       Enter the possible Contact information so that the HP Support agent can easily get back to user with follow up questions. The Contact information text is the only readable text in this binary AHS log file. e.        Press the Download button to start downloading the AHS log file.      If iLO is not available, open the link below and select the OS type. http://h17007.www1.hpe.com/docs/iss/DL360pGen8/tsg/advanced/Content/150999.htm     1.  Please upload the logs to FTP if logs size >5Mb.
